justification: “The first is the Weight of Advice (WoA; Harvey & Fischer, 1997), a widely used metric for advice utilization.”

measured_by: Absolute distance between final judgment and target
justification: “This study also used the distance between and … to directly evaluate the accuracy of the final judgment with advice.”
“After all the tasks, the judges provided numeracy scores (Fagerlin, Zikmund-Fisher, Ubel, Jankovic, Derry, & Smith, 2007).” (The cited work is the Subjective Numeracy Scale).
“The judges indicated their confidence in each judgment on a 10-point Likert scale.”

measured_by: Sum of WoA differences between AI and human advice
justification: “For each judge, the difference in WoA between AI and human … was estimated … and the sum of the differences at 10 types of &)*+,% was used as the algorithm priority for that judge.”
